title: Hills Adventist College
text:
Hills Adventist College is an <a href="Independent%20school">independent</a> <a href="Seventh-day%20Adventist">Seventh-day Adventist</a> <a href="Mixed-sex%20education">co-educational</a> <a href="Pre-school%20education">early learning</a>, <a href="Primary%20school">primary</a> and <a href="Secondary%20school">secondary</a> <a href="day%20school">day school</a>, located across two campuses in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>'s <a href="Hills%20District%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Hills District</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a>, Australia. Enrolments at the College during 2016 totalled 566 students. The junior school, comprising an early learning centre and teaching facilities for students in <a href="Kindergarten">Year K</a> to <a href="Year%204">Year 4</a> is located in <a href="Castle%20Hill%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Castle Hill</a>; and the senior school, comprising teaching facilities for students in <a href="Kindergarten">Year K</a> and <a href="Year%205">Year 5</a> to <a href="Year%2012">Year 12</a>, is located in <a href="Kellyville%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Kellyville</a>. The College is a part of the <a href="Seventh-day%20Adventist%20education">Seventh-day Adventist education system</a>, the world's second largest Christian school system.
Curriculum.
The schools curriculum consists primarily of the standard courses taught at <a href="college%20preparatory%20school">college preparatory school</a>s across the world. All students are required to take classes in the <a href="core%20curriculum">core</a> areas of English, Basic Sciences, Mathematics, a Foreign Language, and Social Sciences.
Spiritual aspects.
All students are required to take part in Bible classes from Year K to <a href="Year%2010">Year 10</a>, and then Studies of Religion (SOR) a 2-unit <a href="Higher%20School%20Certificate%20%28New%20South%20Wales%29">NSW HSC</a> course is mandatory in Year 11 and 12. The Bible classes cover topics in <a href="Bible">biblical</a> history and Bible characters and themes and other Christian doctrines. Weekly, the entire student body gathers together for a chapel service. Outside the classrooms there is year-round spiritually oriented programming that relies on student involvement.
Sport.
The College is part of the Independent Schools Association inter-school sports program - and as such - students have the opportunity to compete at local, regional, state and national levels - depending on their abilities - in sports of their choice and interest.
